summary:
Gerrit Jan Carsjens did a BSc and MSc in Land and Water Use Planning, specialization Land Use Planning, Soil Science and Informatics, at the Wageningen University (The Netherlands). He obtained a PhD degree at the same University, on the topic of GIS-based planning support systems to support strategic spatial planning processes.
He was employed as a scientific researcher at the Winand Staring Centre and the National Institute for Public Health and the Environment (the Netherlands), after which he became an assistant professor in Land Use Planning at the Wageningen University, and associate professor from February 2023.
His educational and research activities focus on strategic spatial planning, environmental assessment, and food systems planning. He is examiner and lecturer of several courses in the bachelor and master program Landscape Architecture and Planning and the master program Urban Environmental Management. He has been publishing in many scientific journals and books, and is involved in several international scientific organizations. He is also a member of the Examining Board Environment and Landscape at the Wageningen University.
